modules.description: Provides pretty-printers for error and write error types, and offers asynchronous operations to disconnect from a device, retrieve block device information, and perform sector-based read and write operations on storage devices. Works with custom error types, Lwt-based asynchronous workflows, and Cstruct.t lists representing data buffers. Used to manage I/O interactions with block devices, ensuring proper handling of data integrity and error conditions during storage operations.

Provides pretty-printers for error and write error types. Manages block device interactions by disconnecting, querying device info, and performing sector-based read and write operations on Cstruct lists. Works with device handles, error types, and sector-aligned data buffers for low-level storage operations.

Provides functions to parse Master Boot Records and extract partition information, returning each partition as a pair of Mbr.Partition.t and a corresponding block device. Operates on raw block devices and MBR-formatted disks, enabling access to individual partitions as separate devices. Enables disk management tasks such as mounting or inspecting specific partitions without modifying the underlying storage.

Provides asynchronous I/O operations for block devices, including error handling, device disconnection, and sector-level read/write actions. Uses custom error types and Lwt for non-blocking execution, with Cstruct.t lists for data manipulation. Supports retrieving device metadata and ensuring data integrity during storage interactions. Examples include reading sector data, writing buffer contents, and managing error states during device operations.

Manages block device interactions through error-aware read and write operations on sector-aligned data, using Cstruct lists and device handles. Supports querying device information, disconnecting devices, and handling error types with detailed pretty-printing. Operations include low-level storage access and error reporting for reliable block device management. Examples include reading sectors from a disk, writing data with error tracking, and inspecting device properties.
